author: {'steamid': '76561198042620952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1370, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1680492476}
review:
[h1] Genre [/h1] Ein Point & Click Adventure

[h1] Story [/h1] Ein Wertvolles GemÃ¤lde scheint aus einer Galerie gestohlen worden zu sein. Wir spielen Lara die fÃ¼r Interpol arbeitet und unser Alter Boss ruft uns deswegen an um uns auf dieser Geschichte anzusetzen, natÃ¼rlich mÃ¶chte er seinen guten Ruf wahren und erpresst uns das wir das ganze Stillschweigend durchfÃ¼hren. Was steckt hinter diesem MysteriÃ¶sen Raub?

[h1] Gameplay [/h1] Es spielt sich wie ein Klassisches Point & Click Adventure. Wir kÃ¶nnen mit der Rechten Maustaste Objekte ansehen und mit der Linken Maustaste mit Objekten interagieren. NatÃ¼rlich sammeln wir auch allerhand GegenstÃ¤nde auf und mÃ¼ssen zwischendurch auch einige im Inventar verwenden bzw. Kombinieren. Die RÃ¤tsel haben eine Gute Schwierigkeit. Ich fand diese nicht zu Leicht aber auch nicht unbedingt schwer, ich musste nie lange Ã¼berlegen um auf die LÃ¶sung zu kommen. Es gibt hier auch wenig Backtracking. Man spielt abwechselnd 2 Charaktere (Lara & Max) und jedesmal haben wir meist immer 3-4 Orte zu denen wir in dem Moment hingehen kÃ¶nnen. Die Orte sind meist sehr Ãœbersichtlich und man kann kaum etwas verpassen. Mit Hilfe der "TAB" Taste kann man sich interagierbare Orte (Hotspots) jederzeit anzeigen lassen. Das Spiel ist komplett auf Deutsch vertont und ich fand die Synchronsprecher ganz in Ordnung wobei "Lara" eindeutig Russin ist und in einer Szene auch darauf aufmerksam macht das sie einen Akzent hat, was sie in der Deutschen Synchro aber eindeutig nicht hat, in der Englischen aber sehr wohl, fand ich etwas seltsam umgesetzt aber natÃ¼rlich nicht weiter wild. Die HintergrÃ¼nde bzw. die Grafik sieht fÃ¼r ein Spiel von "eigentlich" 2008 sehr gut aus. Story ist spannend und fesselt auch gut. Musik ist auch ganz ordentlich

[h1] Pro/Contra [/h1]
+ Gute Story
+ Spannend
+ Musik OK
+ Grafik sieht gut aus
+ RÃ¤tsel sind nicht zu schwer und nicht zu leicht
+ Komplett auf Deutsch vertont

- Leider keine Achievements

[h1] Fazit [/h1] Ein wirklich schÃ¶n gemachtes Point & Click Adventure mit einer spannenden Story die einen schon sehr fesselt, ordentlicher Grafik & Angemessener Schwierigkeit bei den RÃ¤tseln. Wer gerne Point & Click Adventures spielt, kann hier bedenkenlos zugreifen. Es hat mir sehr gut gefallen

author: {'steamid': '76561198132995625', 'num_games_owned': 1401, 'num_reviews': 753, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1677716523}
review:
[h1] memento mori [/h1]
Adventures of 2012.

Colonel Ostankovovich, the commander of a special police department in St. Petersburg and the man who risked his honesty by swearing that no item in the Hermitage would be lost under his command, receives a report of a brief alarm failure at the Hermitage . He suspects something happened. In order not to lose his reputation, he contacts Maxim Durand through Larisa Svetlova. Because of his past, Maxim is at his disposal and has to help him. (Editor)

In search of the stolen paintings, Max and Lara (mostly alone) visit the Hermitage, an old library, Interpol headquarters in Lyon, the residence in Scotland and more. It is played in classic point & click style. Very classic! Without help, without a guide and without hints. For a game that's over 10 years old and that has so many players, that's pretty unusual.
  I only found 8 players who struggled through the game, only 2 of them marked it positively.
Now my evaluation after 4 hours is clearly negative.
Not because it's bad, but because of the gameplay.
In order to get further you need triggers and that often means just walking back and forth, repeatedly in and out or clicking everything that is possible over and over again.
It's a shame because the story is very well done. Clearly negative.

My group and my archive with over 5,300 reviews here:
https://steamcommunity.com/groups/hoi4deu

[h1] Memento Mori [/h1]
Abenteuer von 2012.

Oberst Ostankovich, der Kommandant einer Sonderpolizeiabteilung in St. Petersburg und der Mann, der seine Ehrlichkeit aufs Spiel gesetzt hat, indem er geschworen hat, dass unter seinem Kommando kein Gegenstand in der Eremitage verloren gehen wird, erhÃ¤lt die Meldung eines kurzen Alarmausfalls in der Eremitage . Er vermutet, dass etwas passiert ist. Um seinen Ruf nicht zu verlieren, kontaktiert er Maxim Durand Ã¼ber Larisa Svetlova. Aufgrund seiner Vergangenheit steht Maxim ihm zur VerfÃ¼gung und muss ihm helfen. (Herausgeber)

Auf der Suche nach den gestohlenen GemÃ¤lden besuchen Max und Lara (meist alleine) die Eremitage, eine alte Bibliothek, das Interpol-Hauptquartier in Lyon, die Residenz in Schottland und weitere Orte. Es wird in Klassischer Point & Click manier gespielt. Sehr Klassisch! Ohne Hilfe, ohne Guide und ohne Hinweise. FÃ¼r ein Spiel das Ã¼ber 10 Jahre alt ist und das so viele Spieler haben, ist das schon sehr ungewÃ¶hnlich.
 Gerade mal 8 Spieler hab ich gefunden die sich durch das Spiel gequÃ¤lt haben, nur 2 davon haben es positiv Markiert.
Nun meine Bewertung nach 4 Stunden ist deutlich negativ.
Nicht weil es schlecht ist sondern wegen dem Gameplay.
Um weiter zu kommen benÃ¶tigst du AuslÃ¶ser und das bedeutet oft einfach nur hin und her laufen, mehrmaliges rein und raus oder aber immer wieder alles Anklicken was mÃ¶glich ist.
Schade einfach denn die Geschichte ist ausgesprochen gut gemacht. Ganz deutliches negativ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018432196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 839, 'last_played': 1644038749}
review:
For all the P&C adventure lovers - better do not play this game.

This adventure is one of the most bad games i ever played in my last +30 years of gaming.
A very nice story which simply got not realized as it should have been - this game is clear example of making a game not immersive - very bad mechanics, bad graphics, bad voice acting (english) - even the short sequences are simply bad made - will test the 2nd part too i guess, just to see if improvements have been done, but not really excited to do so yet -.-

That dev better crouches back under the stone he came out from! :grinsam:

Personal Rating: 4/10

Max hat eine kriminelle Vergangenheit als KunstfÃ¤lscher und hat noch eine Rechnung mit Ostankovich offen. Daher hat Ostankovich ihn in der Hand und Max muss ihm unfreiwillig seine Hilfe und Ermittlungsdienste zur VerfÃ¼gung stellen, um schlimmere Konsequenzen zu vermeiden. FÃ¼r ein Adventure aus dem Jahr 2008 geht die Grafik vollkommen in Ordnung. Der Spieler erlebt schÃ¶ne SchauplÃ¤tze, die visuell Ã¼berzeugen. Die deutsche Sprachausgabe ist wirklich gut und auch die musikalische Untermalung kÃ¶nnte aus einem Film stammen. Die Inszenierung ist sehr filmreif und die Umsetzung Ã¼berzeugt. 

Die RÃ¤tsel sind weder bahnbrechend innovativ, noch katastrophal schlecht. Allerdings hatte ich bei einem RÃ¤tsel â€œFehler beim Vergleich Originalbild mit FÃ¤lschung finden" mit einem Bug zu kÃ¤mpfen. Letztendlich habe ich einen Ã¤lteren Spielstand laden mÃ¼ssen, um im Spiel weiterzukommen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198328220721', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1638252904}
review:
Memento Mori is a captivating video game that transports players into a mysterious world where life and death intertwine. Developed by a talented team of developers, this atmospheric adventure offers a unique blend of psychological horror and puzzle-solving gameplay. With its haunting visuals, thought-provoking narrative, and challenging puzzles, Memento Mori promises an unforgettable gaming experience.

Set in a gloomy and enigmatic city, Memento Mori delves into the dark realm of mortality and the human psyche. Players assume the role of a troubled protagonist who becomes entangled in a series of unexplainable events after encountering a cryptic artifact. The storyline explores themes of existentialism, the fragility of life, and the inevitable march towards death.

Memento Mori offers a mix of exploration, puzzle-solving, and occasional stealth elements. As you navigate the hauntingly beautiful environments, you'll encounter various obstacles and mysteries that must be solved to progress. The puzzles range from intricate riddles to intricate mechanisms, requiring you to think critically and pay attention to the smallest details. The game successfully strikes a balance between challenge and accessibility, providing a satisfying gameplay experience for both casual and hardcore gamers.

One of the standout features of Memento Mori is its atmospheric presentation. The game's graphics are exquisitely crafted, with a dark and melancholic aesthetic that perfectly complements the narrative. From eerie alleys to decaying mansions, every location feels meticulously designed to immerse players in a sense of foreboding. The haunting soundtrack further intensifies the atmosphere, ensuring that the game consistently delivers a spine-chilling experience.

The narrative of Memento Mori is masterfully crafted, unfolding gradually as you uncover secrets and interact with a cast of intriguing characters. The developers have skillfully woven a complex web of intrigue, keeping players engaged and invested in discovering the truth behind the protagonist's journey. Each character feels fleshed out, with their own motivations and secrets, adding depth to the overall storyline.

While Memento Mori may not offer multiple endings or branching paths, the game's replayability lies in its intricate puzzles and hidden secrets. Exploring every nook and cranny of the game world rewards players with additional insights, enhancing the overall experience. Additionally, the game's rich atmosphere and engrossing storyline make it worth revisiting to fully appreciate the nuances of the narrative.

Memento Mori is a hauntingly beautiful video game that successfully blends psychological horror, puzzle-solving, and immersive storytelling. With its gripping narrative, challenging puzzles, and atmospheric presentation, it stands as a testament to the power of indie game development. If you're a fan of atmospheric adventures that delve into existential themes and keep you on the edge of your seat, Memento Mori is an experience you won't want to miss. Prepare to confront your own mortality and immerse yourself in this captivating journey into the shadows.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106507444', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1641117981}
review:
This is not a bad game despite the bad reviews. People complained that the game begins with a character searching for her cell phone. I suppose they have never played a game that begins with a tutorial. The purpose of that scene was to familiarize players with how things work. Plenty of games do this. 

The story was actually really engaging. In fact it was probably the strongest part of the game. At times I found myself watching it like a movie. It gets a little ridiculous at the end with an unexpected twist. Because of the epilogue, the ending winds up being very unsatisfying. I guess they were trying to set up for the next game. They should have cut out the entire final chapter.

The biggest issue with this game is how slow everything moves. Not the story, but the actual game progression. Any time you click on something, a little video camera icon pops up and you have to wait a LONG time for the action to finish. There is no way to skip cut scenes or speed anything up, though you can right click to make dialogue go faster. Beyond that, it's not a bad game. Controls are standard for this kind of game and nothing too unusual. The inventory is annoying because it gets in the way of things. Some parts are tedious, but the number of locations is completely manageable and the puzzles are pretty straightforward. Not as bad as the reviews made it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198939930657', 'num_games_owned': 1308, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1611696159}
review:
Good game.
I remember it being quite the banger back then, but that could be nostalgia.
Replaying it I realized that in comparison to other adventures it can be quite tedious or misleading sometimes.
Also prepare for some sudden crashes.
Get it on sale, it has a nice story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961311115', 'num_games_owned': 1604, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1610820139}
review:
Sono un appassionato di avventure grafiche, soprattutto quelle punta e clicca, quindi mi sono buttato "a pesce" su questa fatica di Bohemia Interactive. Intanto piccola nota a margine: la versione del gioco di Steam NON include la lingua italiana, e vista la mole di testo potrebbe essere un problema per chi non mastica l'inglese.
Devo dire che in generale l'avventura lascia un po' a desiderare, la progressione Ã¨ abbastanza lenta e ci sono alcuni enigmi un po' cervellotici. I personaggi non sono molto approfonditi (tranne giusto la protagonista), l'interfaccia di gioco Ã¨ abbastanza pulita anche se a volte si fatica a trovare i punti sensibili. La grafica Ã¨ buona, anche se i movimenti dei personaggi un po' legnosi. La durata soddisfacente.
Alla fine a me il gioco non Ã¨ dispiaciuto perÃ² non Ã¨ certamente una delle avventure grafiche TOP pubblicate in questi anni, diciamo che si trova di meglio!

author: {'steamid': '76561198051019015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1602697165}
review:
All in all, an inoffensive point-and-click adventure game where a pair of art experts recover some stolen pieces of art from an ancient religious organisation.

Puzzles and challenges were straightforward for a semi-casual gamer like myself.

Story dwells into the theme of predestination, but comes off clunky and has weak ties to what is going on in the plot. All told, the story would have been better off focusing on the relationship between the two main characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198930212029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 780, 'last_played': 1600564737}
review:
Memento Mori is a hard game to thumbs up or down. For a budget title point and click it does many things exceptionally well, had details that most adventure games would skip, and you can tell the project was made with passion throughout. It's faults can range from charming to irritating. The game has great music, an interesting plot to start with that reaches it's peak half way but then becomes pretty dry and uninteresting towards the finale. The gameplay is sometimes fun but mostly tedious. 


GOOD
+ The soundtrack (also free download with this version), was really nice and moving. Cinematic strings accompanied by mellow piano pieces were nice on the ears. Though one or two pieces sound a bit 'midi like' for lack of a better word. I did have to turn music volume down quite a lot though!
+ Detailed environments from varying locations. Stylistic angles have that classic adventure game feel that you've probably come to know by now. Lots of things to interact with and dialogue for describing features around the world and items. I can appreciate a more chatty protagonist, it gives them more personality.

+ A surprising amount of single use animations for item interactions, sometimes can be a bit wonky but the game plays quite human. I like to see the characters eyes target an interactable, talk about it, and then grab it, even if it feels lengthy. It all adds immersion. Things moving in the environment background like cars driving by in Russia as just one example, make the world feel lived in.
+ I liked the contrast of different accents in the game. Voice acting ranges from good to subpar, but never bad. Lines are delivered convincingly and there is a lot of dialogue in the game. Lara, who works in France as a Russian Interpol agent was one of the better characters, she was a bit quirky and funny.

+ It may be an endearing quality but I liked the busywork you do reading emails, writing emails, making phonecalls etc. These features are also quite detailed, you get alot of information that at first is a bit overwhelming. It felt pretty grounded and human.



BAD
- The basic main plot of the game is based around a criminal underworld of art theft, forgeries, and cults. For the first half of the game there is rarely any sense of urgency. You spend a hell of a lot of time doing uninteresting day to day tasks such as finding a plug socket for your phone to charge the battery, and finding water to fill a jug, heat on a stove with firewood to warm up and wash your face. These things only felt like filler and made the game feel longer when I wanted to advance the story.
- The story didn't draw me in or interest me. I must admit, a murder mystery is usually more my style but the premise is set up well here with the focus on art theft. Unfortunately it's cluttered and confusing. Often times it felt like dialogue sequences contradicted each other. Around the 60% mark into the game I think I tuned out and it was hard to get re-immersed from then on. A twist involving two characters comes towards the later half of the game, and although I enjoyed the sequence of events leading up to it, the reveal felt rather flat and out of nowhere and from then on it just gets crazier. 

- Graphical oddities such as the BEAMING GOD RAYS that emanate from any light source in the game. A simple light bulb looks like staring into the sun.
- Audible oddities such as dialogue sometimes features reverb to emphasise a rooms open space. Which is great if done right, but it sounds so robotic here And worse so, the reverb effect cuts out immediately after dialogue ends.

- The overlay for item menu very often would pop down and get in the way of my cursor when wanting to leave an area.
- Our lead protagonist Max. A french professor who got caught up in the crime world to pay off hospital bills has a good premise to build the character and should make him likeable despite the bad things he's done. But that being said he is very boring. Max has zero personality and every scene you play as him feels like a drag. This is surprising as Lara the character you start the game as feels much more likeable and relatable.

- Puzzles in the game are predictable and easy. The real difficulty comes from knowing what to do and where to go.
- Despite the context of the situation, the character always speaks out loud, this is hilarious when you're supposed to be keeping a low profile.
- Mechanics such as the 'respond positively/negatively or questionably' was shallow and felt ultimately meaningless. You haven't any idea how you're going to react and if you get it wrong there's no downsides.


Overall I believe that Memento Mori isn't a very fulfilling or memorable experience. I think a lot of heart went into creating it and there's a lot of detail and information to delve into which I wasn't expecting going in. but where it ultimately falls flat is the story. For me personally it wasn't done in a very consistent or appealing manner. A lot of great ideas are thrown into a mix and not all of those ideas are well incorporated in the end result. The gameplay, although very easy to pick up, was meandaring for the most part and littered with chores to keep the player busy for as long as possible. It was okay based on getting it very cheap on sale though, and I hope MM2 can focus on what made the first game decent and fine tune it into something more polished.




5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197994909078', 'num_games_owned': 2604, 'num_reviews': 225, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1585001135}
review:
Generally really nice Czech point n click game with some bugs (EAX cannot be activated even through Alchemy, but I think the original release did not work much better) and some really insulting parts (the trip to Lisbon) but as an adventure game it is intriguing. It is funny to note the similarities with Still Life: two investigators, her being the law enforcer and him being the artist, some gruesome deaths, and paintings being the plot trigger.

Talking about triggers, there are quite a few in here (you are warned, because they are explicit, violent and strong). But apart from that, the casual xenophobia (really, do these developers think that all the foreigners are that challenged and mean?), repetitive music and unskippable dialogues it is a very, very nice game, honest, at least if you like the genre. Way above Mystery of the Druids having a similar tone.

als an ein 2-Dimensionales Point and Click. Die Grafik ist sehr schÃ¶n, die Sprachausgabe sehr gut. die RÃ¤tsel sind zum Teil
schwer, aber im Internet gibt es einige LÃ¶sungen. Kann dieses Adventure Freunden dieses Genres nur empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039451680', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1558729989}
review:
I must say that I enjoyed it. It is classic point and click adventure with nice story. It is more like interactive film because it is really smooth. 
From technical point of view I faced some crashes, but those are related specially to localized version. Al those probles were ok in english version.
For me there is only one minus. Puzzles in this game are really easy. There is not anything hard.

In summary I give this 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994971393', 'num_games_owned': 2925, 'num_reviews': 287, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1550939797}
review:
I normally love point and click adventure games, but .. how to describe what's wrong with this one. Let's try an anecdote from the game (very minor spoilers):

In one part of the game, you are in an office. From there, you have to walk across 4 screen transitions and a city transition to notice that a museum has a security camera. With this shocking revelation that no one could have guessed, you get to walk all the way back to the Office you started in to ask if there is security footage from the camera.

*headdesk* This game is full of absurd things like that. Unnecessary round trips to do obvious things, incongruous sequence of events.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141432496', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 781, 'last_played': 1542050583}
review: Memento Mori offers an enjoyable gameplay for a point click player. Some people might find gameplay too easy, but it enables you to follow the story nicely. There are in fact not too many puzzles in this game, but in the case of this game it is actually a good thing. You don't have to deal with tons of irrelevant puzzles messing the story up. The game always makes you wonder what will happen next and the story is astonishing.

Das Spiel ist nicht angenehm zu spielen, weil hier so viele kÃ¼nstliche Bremser eingebaut wurden. StÃ¤ndig bekommt man von den Hauptcharakteren "Warum sollte ich ...?" oder "Ich mag nicht" zu hÃ¶ren. 
[spoiler] Beim Ende der Geschichte wÃ¼rde mich schon interessieren, ob den Entwicklern die Zeit ausgegangen ist oder ob das Story-Konzept zu wenig hergibt? [/spoiler]
Dem zweiten Teil werde ich mich nun widmen, aber wenn das wieder so weiter geht, dann wird auch dieser Platz auf der SSD wieder frei.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067156079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1518498616}
review: Je ne peux dÃ©cemment pas recommander ce jeu car il a vraiment trop mal veilli. (bug l'ordi, qualitÃ© des Ã©nigmes, etc..) Pourtant le scÃ©nario est intÃ©ressant. Le problÃ¨me Ã©tant que le second volet n'a jamais Ã©tÃ© traduit mÃªme si apparemment il exciterait un patch fr. Etant donnÃ© la considÃ©ration de l'Ã©diteur au public franÃ§ais et le non-support pour corriger certains bug, je vous recommande d'aller voir ailleurs : Still Life, Black Mirror, Syberia etc..

author: {'steamid': '76561198003166569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1514239544}
review: I can not recommend this game. The story line is shallow, controls are misleading and unnatural. Mysteries to be solved include "how to boil water to wash your face" and "find wall socket in your own apartment". Some solutions of tasks doesnt even make sense or have much more simple resolution - unavailable for player. Camera is very bad. I played with CZ localization and my god - it is horrible. Missing voice acting replaced by computer voice. And I was not able to finish one task, apparently because of wrong order of translation in the list - thanks to walkthrough, otherwise I would not be able to finish it. Not to mention a bug in early location crashing the game - losing all your progress. You can overcome this bug by changing the language of the game (bug is only in czech version). This game is incomplete garbage with shallow babbling dialogs, unnatural tasks and ilogical solutions. If you want to solve controls, cameras and bugs more then puzzles, enjoy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208638752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1513105095}
review:
I play adventure games  more than 20 years. 
This is a great game with nice story, logical puzzles and different endings !
It has some flaws, in characters expressions, I didn't mind the voice acting - sometimes it's fun in this genre. 
I 'd like to see more games like this and I can't understand someone who doesn't recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107081879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1512344430}
review:
Un point'n'click agrÃ©able avec une histoire intÃ©ressante, des Ã©nigmes logiques et pas trop difficiles et 8 fins diffÃ©rentes.

Beaucoup se sont plaints du doublage anglais mais, en tout cas, le doublage franÃ§ais est plutÃ´t bon, et fait par des doubleurs connus.

On pourra nÃ©anmoins regretter la lenteur des animations et des dÃ©placement (assez commune dans ce type de jeux) et le manque de profondeur des personnages principaux.

Si vous avez aimÃ© les Black Mirror et les Secret Files, il est probable que vous aimiez ce jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140435102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 185, 'playtime_forever': 791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 791, 'last_played': 1510695456}
review:
Special game to me. First of all, it was bugged so I had to ask some technical help on forum and developer who were only partly helpful and I was able to finish game despite that game crashed in halfway through when I was playing in Czech language. English dubbing did not work for me at all, only subtitles. Czech language dubbing causes crash and sometimes ruins immersion.

Animations are sometimes glitchy but overally look good. Graphics decent and dialogues are somehow suitable for the atmosphere.

Czech dubbing is another problem. Actors read text like they do not know what is the clue in game. Example, orator says Spain instead of Portugal, like it does not matter - those are different countries.

There is NPC in the room, you can talk to, you save game, resume game and he disappears. One time, someone called, I pressed ESC because I wanted to save and Lara did not even have chance to take it.

There is for some a kind of annonying part where your characters use e-mail and phone relatively often but it does not ruin immersion, only complicates it for players and gives us players feeling how desperate might the characters sometimes feel.

You can not skip some animations and so will annoy you running back and forth for clues. But skipping with double click to another location works fine in most cases.

There are quite a lot of locations for such short adventure and camera is zoomed out so you see most of room but I missed some "hidden" items to look at or pick up, just because they were tiny and on the edge of screen. Clearly, it was intention but as you mostly use TAB to your adventage as it shows items you can interact with, it does not show ALL of them. At least it helps.

Sometimes game shows you what your character is doing with zoomed window that is from different angle but is sometimes glitched when it merges with the background.

You will play as Lara seperately and Max seperately doing their own adventures under command of Ostankovic who pushes them to take risk and go look further for clues of lost "quest" things. Public can not know about the loss, so everything you do with Lara and Max is secret and you will have to stay undercover and be careful what you do, cause it matters in the END. Though at first, you have no clue what is to come, maybe another replay would change things, as there are 8 different endings.

There were two puzzles which did not make sense to me and I only had to use walkthrough, I would probably have to use many combinations to get the right answer. It was more about mindset, understanding what the legend says rather than what was most obvious or logical answer. I can not say it is bad, I was surprised by how badly I was looking for a solution.

It has nice cutscenes which really add value of drama to the game. Game has nice plot twist by the end of it.

I saw problems in this game since first minute, it could be polished better, but as the story enveloped, I enjoyed it, and game gives you minor clues about the upcoming plot twist.

It is clearly not so great, but I like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969749884', 'num_games_owned': 2459, 'num_reviews': 1422, 'playtime_forever': 2363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1528636179}
review:
Memento Mori is a great classic point and click adventure with mostly easy difficulty, excellent writing, good graphics which scale rather nicely to 4k, a captivating soundtrack and only falls flat on a few ends by featuring absolutely horrible voice acting as well as very stiff animations.

The downsides are more than made up by the great story though, which progresses at a steady yet sometimes maybe slightly too slow pace.

It feels neither too long nor too short and has a quite interesting finale with quite a few unforeseeable plot twists.

Personally I had zero zechnical issues with this on Win10 scaled to 4k, so I'm not sure where all the mixed ratings stem from. This game does actually deserve a solid 70-75% upvote.

On sale this can be picked up along with its sequel by each and any adventure enthusiast without further thought.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1508501584}
review:
Tags: Adventure - P&C - Point&Click
Note: Tab to highlight hotspots
         Double click to run

Note: Some reviewers are reporting savegame and loadstate issues with this game. Some of them report the menu art going black making menu navigation impossible. Manual saving if available should be trusted over autosaves. Will edit review and possibly adjust rating and even remove from Library when i get to playtest in depth. I am having no issue so far, especially compared to Memento Mori2 which just goes blackscreen in all menus after the game initializes.

TLDR: Feels like a hybrid between a tank-controls adventure and a proper point&click one. The character's head follows nearest hotspot but navigation is entirely done by mouse removing nearly all the clunkyness usually associated with these kind of engines and control schemes. 

Has an intriguing psychological thriller style thematic backdrop. Engine offer a healthy amount of real PC resolutions. 3D engine looked slick and really well executed with a lot of physics happening with the character's models. Responsive engine.

The voice acting had clear foreign accents but was still clear both in enunciation and in emotional tone.

Conclusion: First impressions are solid all around. Looking forward to spending time with this one. Hopefully it works correctly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111507425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 1363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1660605879}
review:
I really enjoyed this game. It was intriguing and immersive. The graphics were wonderful,  I  really liked the voice accents and found the animations amazing. 
So much work went into this game and it shows.
Totally unexpected ending and I now feel like playing it again soon to see what differences occur with different actions....

author: {'steamid': '76561198312746645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1506540677}
review: honestly, i liked it. :D nice detective work, interesting locations and a good, dramatic soundtrack (which felt a bit weird sometimes though as it was looped and didn't fit in a 100%). the voice-acting didn't bother me at all - i enjoyed the character's accents a lot tbh! as the puzzles were easy to solve the story continued in a good pace. yes, this game is a bit buggy and not for everyone, but if you're able to enjoy point & clicks that are not so well polished, i'd recommend it when it's on sale. (i got it for 1,99 â‚¬ - that was totally worth it!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198145416535', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1497119986}
review: Having read the mixed reviews, I launched the game with many reservations and quite a bit of trepidation. Starting off with the first puzzle, searching for your phone charger while being in a hurry seems a bit silly (as it has been pointed out by other reviewers), but it's not something [i]that[/i] game breaking. The camera and general movement on the other hand needed some getting used to. On my system at least, it had a somewhat wobbly sensation, like walking through jelly. The story though was very interesting and developed in an extremely unexpected way. Hopping through Europe was really fun, and as the plot progressed, I became increasingly invested in Lara and Max, a delightful pair. The background story was something rarely (if ever) seen (I won't spoil anything here) which was a breath of fresh air opposite other, more stale ones (e.g. Templars, or other Dan Brown-esque tropes). There are also some actions you may take, that influence the ending of the game. [spoiler]My options, unfortunately, didn't favour my heroes and I was quite sad at the end![/spoiler] I really can't wait to play the next game in the series!

author: {'steamid': '76561198121981963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1492499349}
review:
The story is good but the game play is horrendous.

It takes about 30 seconds to activate and go down an elevator and if you are trying to play without a walkthrough that time adds up especially when you don't know that the tab button highlights things. Also the controls feel clunky and the voice acting really sucks.

Don't pay more than a couple of bucks for this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999015663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1480807200}
review: This game is heavily underrated. I didn't expect much at first because of the meta score, but it turned out to be actually very good. The only thing that let me down was a presence of some annoying bugs. Not the technical ones, the game seems to be stable enough, I had to restart it only once. I mean the bugs in the "quest" - sometimes the dialogs suggested something had been done, while it hadn't. As if it wouldn't expect a different order of doing things, even though it is possible. Therefore sometimes it was very confusing as I didn't know what to do only because of a bug in some of the dialogs. Also sometimes, there was a missing dialog voiceover or a one they obviously forgot to translate from Czech.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076910910', 'num_games_owned': 2200, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1479474808}
review:
Didnt like it at all. Its one of those point and click adventures thats wants to live through its story, which wasnt even great though. At first i thought it wants to be a simulator since you really need to do every single thing yourself, which just seems unnecessarily time consuming. The 3d is annoying and on top of that its super easy and feels short.
(played in offline mode)

author: {'steamid': '76561198029242602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1466866063}
review:
Gutes Adventure mit sehr schÃ¶ner Grafik und Musik. Besonders stark fand ich das Ende.

Negativ sind vereinzelte Bugs und die zeitweilig langen Bewegungsanimationen. AuÃŸerdem sind  die deutschen Sprecher manchmal etwas unpassend. 

FÃ¼r Fans von Mysterie auf jeden Fall einen Kauf wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077719495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 972, 'last_played': 1464732889}
review: Your typical point and click game but this one I found to be long, slow, and dull. The solutions to puzzles and combining items is not clear and often I was unsure how to proceed in the game or what the current goal was. Meh to put it simply. I would also like to add this game has alternate endings depending on the player's actions and ability. The better you do the happier the ending; the worse you play the more bleak and depressing the ending.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002568128', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1463367511}
review: Poorly designed and dated with bad voice acting.  It doesn't matter if you don't mind shit games, but if they're designed in a way that makes progression nearly impossible even with consulting walkthroughs (a poor sign already), then there's no point.  Avoid even if on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995272278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1458601599}
review:
Ich hatte das Spiel vor einem Jahr gekauft (Windows Vista) da hatte ich keine Probleme.
Vor zwei Wochen hatte ich mit dem Spiel erneut angefangen - da lief ebenfalls alles vÃ¶llig problemlos.
Jetzt komme ich aus dem Urlaub zurÃ¼ck, wollte weiterspielen - zack, das Spiel verlangt plÃ¶tzlich die CD...
Wozu holt man sich ein Spiel Ã¼ber Steam wenn man plÃ¶tzlich nach der CD gefragt wird ?
Mehrmals de-installiert und neu raufgezogen - Problem taucht immer wieder auf.
Keine Ahnung woran es liegt - an meinem PC sowie an meinem Steamaccount oder dem Spiel an sich hat sich etwas verÃ¤ndert.
Sehr Ã¤rgerlich und damit auch keine Empfehlung wert (Windows 10)

author: {'steamid': '76561198064055917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1457443897}
review:
Zuallererst:
Das Spiel ist in der Steam-Version komplett verbuggt. Dies wird mit fortlaufenden Spielstand immer schlimmer. Hatte ich zwischendurch nur vielleicht 10 TotalabstÃ¼rze des Computers, so waren es in den letzten 15 Spielminuten sicherlich 8 oder 9. Das ging noch halbwegs in Ordnung, solange der Spielstand automatisch gespeichert wurde, spÃ¤ter war dies auch nur noch bedingt der Fall. Speichern war auch keine Option, denn dann hatte der Computer keinen Ton mehr - auch nicht, als ich zur Probe Youtube anstellte. Nur ein Neustart konnte das Problem beheben. Als ich mir Memento Mori in die Taskleiste zog, startete das Spiel auf Englisch. Nach einigen Neustarts konnte ich wieder auf Deutsch spielen, im Startbildschirm blieb ein Mischmasch aus Englisch und Deutsch zurÃ¼ck.


Meine Spielzeit wird von Steam mit 9 Stunden angegeben, wobei ich einige Passagen doppelt spielen musste.

Die Steuerung ist sehr gut - trifft man auf einen Hotspot, verÃ¤nderte sich der Zeiger - in der Regel konnte man mit der linken Maustaste den Gegenstand untersuchen (Zahnrad) und mit der rechten ansehen (Auge). Das Inventar und das HauptmenÃ¼ erreichte man, indem man die Maus an den oberen Bildschirmrand zog. Mit Doppelklick brachte man die Figuren zum Rennen.

Die Geschichte hat mir persÃ¶nlich sehr gut gefallen - Museen, MÃ¶nche, Geheimdienste und VerschwÃ¶rungen. Ebenso waren die Charaktere passend.

Die RÃ¤tsel
waren alle recht leicht, nur bei einem MatherÃ¤tsel brauchte ich die KomplettlÃ¶sung. Das nÃ¤chste Ziel wird einem immer mitgeteilt, leider gibt es keinen Notizblock, auf dem die Handlung festgehalten wird.

Die Grafik war groÃŸartig. Man konnte die Struktur der Wildlederjacken ganz genau bestaunen, die die Wassereffekte waren superb. Dagegen wirklichen die KÃ¶rper oft ein wenig klobig.

Fazit

WÃ¤ren die vielen Bugs nicht gewesen, Memento Mori wÃ¤re ein vorzÃ¼gliches Adventure gewesen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028018534', 'num_games_owned': 1330, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1453119139}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=84jEsLSe91Y

Memento Mori â€“ remember that you can die. This is the medieval Latin theory and practice of reflection on mortality, especially as a means of considering the vanity of earthly life and the transient nature of all earthly goods and pursuits. It is related to the ars moriendi ("The Art of Dying") and related literature. Memento Mori has been an important part of ascetic disciplines as a means of perfecting the character, by cultivating detachment and other virtues, and turning the attention towards the immortality of the soul and the afterlife. This is taken from Wikipedia and it's essential for part of the game.

This game have a lot of options. The game is highly scalable â€“ resolution, monitor frequency, V-sync, AA, shader quality, texture filtering, mipmaping, dynamic shadows and reflections. But when I put everything on high the framerate tanks. I have decent PC and this shouldn't happen, the game is from 2008. Also there are a lot of audio options and even if you want your cursor can be animated or not, which is a neat little feature.

In the game you control two characters. The first is Larisa Svetlova â€“ ex-police officer in Russia, now working for Interpol. The second and the main character here is Maxim Durrand. He use to forge painting and sell, until he got caught by Larisa. Instead sending him to jail, he agree to become informant for the russian police. Both Max and Lara are drag in investigation by Colonel Ostankovich. There was an alarm failure in Hermitage museum in Saint Petersburg and Ostankovich that something happens. He force Lara to send Max to see if it's missing something in the museum. Of course there is â€“ few paintings From here on their own they travel to Lisbon, Lyon, residence in Scotland and even in Finland in search for the missing paintings. Their journey is acompanied by mysterious deaths, secret signs, interrogating suspects and solving puzzles. The story is good, but not great. It starts slow and took a few hours to get interesteing and for a adventure game this is not great. I don't want to spoil anything, but the last act throws a lot on you, that wasn't hinted throughout the game that this maybe how it will end. This is good and bad. Just it came from nowhere. The game wraps up really well. It was enjoyble, connects all the little hints, that you see, but from which you can't piece the ending before you see it. It's hard to explain without ruining the end, so trust me on this one. I just wish the story wasn't dragging so much in the beginning.

For an adventure game the most important things for me are story and puzzles. I already cover the story. As for the puzzles I can say they are not hard. I was stuck briefly on one or two. All of them have common sense â€“ pick up this, put it there, combine objects, look at some inside your inventory or around you. I didn't find any obscure or illogical. Some of them are quite unique. They are 3D puzzles. What I mean is you look an object and you can rotate the camera around it in 360 degrees. I like them, but they are few and far between.

You have a conversation system with 3 type of answers most of the time, but what will a character say when you choose â€œpositivelyâ€, â€œnegativelyâ€ or â€œquestionablyâ€, you can't really tell. Most of the times they will say things that doesn't sound like what you choose.

The graphics are alright. Here all backgrounds are 3D, not pre-render like older adventure games and they look great. But some characters model doesn't look that good, like Maxs for example. And NPC's also suffer with the lack of enough polish.

Also the character movement is not good. It looks cluncky. It's like the game didn't came out in 2008.

The level design is really great. I like all the places you visit and they have a lot of detail put in them. There almost always things that can be clicked just for the character to say something and they are not essential for the story and puzzles. It's great to have a minor thing like that. It's about the atmosphere. Even something like Lara's office looks nice and have enough background details to feel like a real place. 

For me the worst part here is the sound design, especually the voice acting. It's bad. It's not unbearably bad, but still. The only one I like is the narrator. Lara and Max suppose to have accents, but the feel forced and the line delivery is not great. At one scene Max is supose to be angry, but it's so badly played and I just cringe. This ruin the moment.

As for the music I can't point a single track. It's not bad, it's just nothing special, nothing to remember. Most of them include a piano, but the melodies feels like i've heard them before in movies and games. There are occasional deep male vocals accompanied by orchestra, but non of the tracks contribute that much for the atmosphere.

The sound effects are are really good. Things like walking, moving an object, hitting crushing and envoirmental sounds and feel proper. I wish the music and voice acting were on the same level.

There are quite number of issues I have with the game, mostly are minor things, but nonetheless they drag the game down. Cutscene. They don''t look good. They are blurry, like you have something on the screen. Character movement. When you make Lara or Max take something, for example, it take them ages to do it and it's frustrating. Speaking. When character observe something, he is saying out loud. Sometimes it's important and an NPC shouldn't hear it. It's bizzare. Lip sync. It's bad and you can even barely seen the mouths moving. Camera. A lot of times obstruct my view and I wonder around trying to figure out what am I supose to do. And in cutscenes often is badly placed and heads are cutoff. Lara. She is not an interestig character. I didn't care for her like I care about Max. Some are minor issues, but when you combine with the pacing of the story and bad voice acting, you see why the game is dragged down.

I consider Memento Mori decent adventure game. As a whole the game won't be stuck in my mind, but the ending will be. It have great locations, good plot, not-so-hard puzzles and few endings, but pacing, bad voice acting and other little issues drag the game down. I recommend it, but on deep sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052243480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1453211729}
review:
Oberst Ostankovic steht kurz vor seiner Ehrung als herausragendes Mitglied der russischen Miliz. Sein Aufgabengebiet ist die Ãœberwachung der Kunstwerke in der Eremitage in St. Petersburg. UnglÃ¼cklicherweise verschwindet kurz vor seinem groÃŸen Tag eines der berÃ¼hmtesten GemÃ¤lde der Sammlung.

Ostankovic bittet die ehemalige russische Polizistin Lara um Hilfe. Lara arbeitet jetzt bei Interpol und ist dort mit Kunstraub betraut worden. Zudem hat er den ehemaligen FÃ¤lscher Maxime bei der Hand, welcher fÃ¼r ihn arbeiten muss, um nicht erneut festgenommen zu werden.

Die Geschichte wird abwechselnd aus Laras und Maximes Perspektive gespielt, dazu kommen verschiedene Handlungsorte. Genretypisch geht es darum, kleine RÃ¤tsel zu lÃ¶sen und GegenstÃ¤nde zu kombinieren, um im Geschehen voranzukommen.
Lara und Max stehen miteinander per Mail und Handy in Kontakt und kÃ¶nnen Ã¼ber diese Wege auch mit dem Oberst kommunizieren. Dieser will vor allem eins: Den Kunstraub und seine Folgen geheim halten, um seine eigene BefÃ¶rderung nicht zu gefÃ¤hrden.

Das Spiel hat wunderschÃ¶n gestaltete HintergrÃ¼nde und auch die Darstellung der historischen GemÃ¤lde ist gut umgesetzt worden. Insbesondere wenn man bedenkt, dass Â»Memento MoriÂ« bereits auf die acht Jahre zugeht.
Leider sehen die Figuren und teilweise auch die GegenstÃ¤nde im Spiel selbst fÃ¼r das Alter schÃ¤big aus. Insbesondere die Haare wirken aufgemalt und die Animationen sind stellenweise sehr umstÃ¤ndlich und hakelig umgesetzt worden.
Positiv ist allerdings anzumerken, dass Â»Memento MoriÂ« nicht wie manch anderer Genre-Vertreter mit einem unendlichen, super-kompresiven Inventar ausgestattet ist. In die Taschen der Figuren kommt nur, was auch in Taschen passt. Alles andere tragen sie in der Hand und sind damit fÃ¼r einen Moment blockiert, um Dinge aufzuheben oder zu benutzen.
Das Spiel bietet in den ÃœbergÃ¤ngen zwischen den einzelnen Akten Cutscenes, bei denen sich die Entwickler auch MÃ¼he gegeben haben. Sie sind optisch auf der HÃ¶he der damaligen Zeit und sehr ansprechend.

Die Bedienung ist solides Pointâ€™nâ€™Click. Allerdings ist der Cursor mitunter ungenau und es erfordert ein wenig Herumprobieren, genau die Stelle zu treffen, nach der man sucht. DarÃ¼ber hinaus sind die AusgÃ¤nge auf den Karten teilweise unpassend bis unlogisch gelegt worden, sodass man dazu neigt, sich auf die falsche Karte zu klicken.

Um die GegenstÃ¤nde zu benutzen, gibt es nur die MÃ¶glichkeit der linken bzw. rechten Maustaste, sprich: Ein Gegenstand kann nur auf eine Weise benutzt oder untersucht werden.
Kombination findet im Inventar statt und ist weitgehend logisch, artet aber stellenweise zur Friemelarbeit aus, wenn Lara zum Beispiel einen neuen Akku in ihr Handy einsetzt.

Das Spiel ist musikalisch unaufdringlich und passend unterlegt worden. Ein Highlight ist die Szene in der russischen Disco, wo tatsÃ¤chlich russischer Punkrock gespielt wird.
Die Soundeffekte sind dagegen teilweise zeitversetzt zu den Ereignissen. Die Sprachausgabe ist gut, einigen Sprechern fehlt es allerdings an GefÃ¼hl fÃ¼r ihre Rolle. Vielleicht liegt es aber auch an der ruppigen Animation der Figuren, dass Stimme, Sprachmelodie und Charakter nicht zusammen zu passen scheinen.

Das Spiel ist im groÃŸen und ganzen schÃ¶n umgesetzt worden, leider geht das Flair der verschiedenen Handlungsorte etwas verloren. Vor allem dadurch, dass unbeteiligte Nebenfiguren in Deutsch reden. Das gilt fÃ¼r Lyon genauso wie fÃ¼r Petersburg oder irgendeine andere Location. Hier hÃ¤tte man durchaus mehr AtmosphÃ¤re reinbringen kÃ¶nnen.

Fazit

Das Spiel macht auf mich einen durchschnittlichen Eindruck. Der Versuch, auf der kleinen Welle neuer Adventures in den 2000er Jahren mitzuschwimmen, ohne das Spiel richtig fertiggestellt zu haben.

Die Geschichte ist solide. Eine Sekte stiehlt Bilder aus einem Museum, Interpol wird eingeschaltet und der Ã¼berwachende Offizier des Museums bangt um seine Rente, sollte das Treiben auffliegen. Leider tragen die Dialoge die Story nicht mit.

SÃ¤tze und Aufforderungen werden unnÃ¶tig wiederholt, dafÃ¼r fehlen an anderen Stellen wichtige Hinweise, was man tun kÃ¶nnte. Man kann Dialoge Ã¼berspringen, die Informationen zum Vorankommen enthalten, selbst beim ersten Spielen. DafÃ¼r gibt es keine richtigen GesprÃ¤chsoptionen. Ein falsch gelaufenes GesprÃ¤ch kann ohne Konsequenzen sooft wiederholt werden, bis man die richtige Antwort gefunden hat. Alternative LÃ¶sungswege gibt es keine.

Die Cutscenes sind schÃ¶n anzusehen, aber genauso wie einige Animationen beim Betreten von RÃ¤umen einfach zu viel und zu langatmig. Insgesamt fehlt dem Spiel der richtige Drive in der Umsetzung, um einen zum Durchspielen zu animieren. Nur die Frage, wer diese Sekte ist (die erst nach einigen Stunden Spielzeit auftauchen) allein, reicht nicht aus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000843128', 'num_games_owned': 1040, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 1123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 930, 'last_played': 1595024788}
review:
Excellent point and click adventure game for me, visuals are nice, models and animation is pretty good (FMV sequences not so much), good voice and locations, characters are solid.

The story is intriguing and has a strangeish mix of real-life and supernatural entwined, with a twist at the end that didn't hit me as hard as it perhaps should have but may impress others more so.

The puzzles overall are mostly logical and have a unique mechanic by allowing you to rotate around objects to find clues, information or switches which adds a nice element the 2d counterparts don't or aren't able to showcase.

There are however 2 to 3 dodgy puzzles. I had to go on the internet twice, once for some dialogue refresh to remember what I was trying to do next and then for the symbol puzzle towards the end which I don't think was done as well as the others in terms of figuring it out for yourself.

I'd say a very solid 8.5/10

review:
Un thriller sympathique, intriguant oÃ¹ deux hÃ©ros seront forcÃ©s de travailler pour une pourriture d'officier du KGB. Vol de tableaux, meurtres, le scÃ©nario est allÃ©chant et nous donne envie de poursuivre le jeu. Les Ã©nigmes sont pour la plupart toutes logiques et pas trop difficiles.

Cependant la fin est assez dÃ©cevante. On tombe dans l'esotÃ©rique un peu facile, "magique". L'une des rÃ©vÃ©lations finales est intÃ©ressante et bien menÃ©e (bien qu'en partie prÃ©visible) mais la fin est un peu trop brutale.

Il parait que l'Ã©pilogue peut changer selon nos actions au cours du jeu, mais je ne vois pas ce qui justifierait nÃ©anmoins une rejouabilitÃ© du titre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198177942134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1444189931}
review:
I really, really wanted to like this game. I've been a fan of adventure point and click games since their heyday in the 90s. It does have some good elements and some that are lacking. For the short version; if it's on sale and you need something to do for the next 10 hours, get it. If you're expecting a great adventure game on the scale of Longest Journey or Syberia, you're in for a big letdown. I'm only going to select the "yes" for recommending this game because I don't want this genre to die. I want more developers to create more adventure games!

Pros:
****The characters' voices all have appropriate regional accents. The French character of Max has a French accent and the Russian character of Lara has a charming Russian accent. Points for authenticity!
****Like most adventure games, there are puzzles and they all fit into the context of the game and had logical answers. Some may have been a little too easy while others required a bit too much pixel hunting. All in all though, the puzzles were good.
****Nice graphics and scenery design. I'm a digital artist so I always appreciate great graphics and well rendered 3D models. Some character animations were used time and again but I came to see them as just character quirks rather than the developer recycling animations. 
****The game took about 10 hours for me to complete and I only had to check a walk-through once because I missed clicking on something in a scene. Since I bought this game when is was about $3, I'd say I made a fantastic investment. 

Cons
****The story doesn't really make any sense and by the time you get to the ending you will have a feeling of  WTF?! Even though they had the character explain the entire story and why everything happened at the end of the game (it was a worse "entire plot explanation" than you'd find in one of the old Sean Connery James Bond movies), it still made no sense to me at all. You know what people say about the ending of Lost? This ending tops that. I understand what they were saying but, logically, it makes no sense to me.
****The "multiple endings" thing is a joke. If you don't do something in a few scenes then you get a different voice-over epilogue. That's it. I was quite disappointed by that. I love games were my choices matter but this had nothing to do with choice and everything to do with just crossing all the T's and dotting the I's. 

So yeah, technically good but story-wise it's confusing and forgettable. Like I said, if it goes on sale again at a cheap price then pick it up for a great time-killer. If you're expecting a great adventure game where your choices actually matter and there is a fantastic story, go look up Dreamfall Chapters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095917598', 'num_games_owned': 497, 'num_reviews': 1794, 'playtime_forever': 4261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1664348282}
review:
Memento Mori Ã© um jogo sobre a morte. Um adventure point-and-click 3D feito pela empresa tcheca Centauri Production que divide atenÃ§Ãµes entre 2 personagens que sÃ£o ex-namorados e trabalham em lados diferentes da lei: uma Ã© Agente da Interpol que faz certos trabalhos fora dos livros e ele Ã© um ex-agente que foi pego devido aos seus erros no passado. No comeÃ§o o que parece ser um simples roubo de pinturas de um museu acaba em uma grande conspiraÃ§Ã£o de uma religiÃ£o esquecida pela humanidade hÃ¡ sÃ©culos.

Nada Ã© muito trabalhado no jogo, mas tudo funciona. O jogo se passa em vÃ¡rios paÃ­ses como Portugal, FranÃ§a, RÃºssia e EscÃ³cia - e o mais legal Ã© ver que os personagens falam a sua lingua local e quando falam em inglÃªs, tem o sotaque da regiÃ£o. Por exemplo: quando viajamos para Portugal, o personagem nÃ£o sabe falar portuguÃªs, portanto ele se limita a dialogar apenas com quem sabe inglÃªs - e nÃ³s sabemos que nem todo mundo por aÃ­ sabe. Outros pequenos detalhes incluem bandas de rock russas em um bar gÃ³tico suburbano e a narraÃ§Ã£o secundÃ¡ria que lembra das suas decisÃµes tomadas durante o capÃ­tulo.

Para um jogo do gÃªnero, Ã© muito fÃ¡cil de ser terminado e nÃ£o exige tanta habilidade quanto outros jogos anteriores, mas a simplicidade pode cativar novos jogadores que tenham medo de experimentar algo deste gÃªnero mas teme que muitas complexidades podem acabar estragando a experiÃªncia. If there is one thing that impressed me in this game, it's the fact that there are animations to every action and all of them fit perfectly with the surroundings. This really is a good game, with many endings, even if the story is a bit special (but i won't spoil).

-Histoire sympa, qui se laisse suivre. De plus le doublage VF est correct.
-Jeu assez accesible, les enigmes sont plutot logiques (il y a quelques maladresse mais on lui pardonnera).

Points nÃ©gatifs :
-Les diffÃ©rents Ã©vÃ©nements manquent cruellement de dynamisme, c'est relativement mou.
-Le cadrage lors des cinÃ©matique est mal fichu, des tÃªtes sont coupÃ©s lors des dialogues par exemple.
-Certaines animations sont rigides et lentes, les mouvements de la bouche lors des conversations sont mal faites et ne suivent pas forcÃ©ment ce que disent les personnages.
-Les diffÃ©rents Ã©lÃ©ments qui mÃ©nent aux diffÃ©rents fins sont la plupart du temps des petits dÃ©tails et il est facile de passer a cÃ´tÃ©, ils ne sont pas assez mis en avant, pas assez explicite.
-La musique pas assez diversifiÃ© a mon gout.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019897351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 771, 'last_played': 1431721658}
review:
Actually this game leaves different feelings. First of all it is good story. It is serious, creepy, consistent and mysterious. Good police quest. There is no crazy level of  stereotypes about russia, no stalin, rape and drunken murders, as we get used this days in popular culture. Thanks to devs for that. 

At the same time character and story development a bit slow, there is not many crazy twists and turns. Game is pretty straightforward.  

I recommend it, it was fun to play and to follow the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006176581', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1427277420}
review:
When playing through this game I could only help but think about what Stephen King said about Kubrick's film "The Shining." He said that it was like a fancy car without an engine. That is exactly what Memento Mori is like. It may look great, but it just can't do that much. The look of the game is really great. The beginning is very promising with a dead scientist surfacing and it is apparent that you will be involved in finding out why and how he died and your first task in this point and click adventure is to get dressed and find your cell phone so you can charge it. I'm dead serious. The game is full of mundane tasks like this. Point and clicks are usually known for their puzzles and their stories. The puzzles are pretty lacking, and even when you do get a puzzle, they aren't that difficult. There are more mundane tasks then puzzles in this game. 
Well, if the story is great it doesn't matter about the lack of puzzles right? Well....The story isn't bad. I've ready other reviews saying that this is a story driven game that pushes you to keep playing. I beg to differ. I felt that the story was nothing really special. Honestly, this game was a chore to play, due to the lack of brainpower this game required and the cast of characters. On the whole, the performances are hit and miss. Sometimes the voice acting is great, and other times you can almost visualise the actor in the booth with the script in front of him. What also drives me crazy is that while you may hear anger or frustration in the characters voice, the body language and facial expressions of the character do not convey any of this emotion. It's very easy to separate the voice from the character, and that is annoying. This game has also been praised for its ending. Depending on what you do and say throughout the game (Mass Effect even affected point and click games) you will get one of six endings. The problem that I see with the ending is that it feels disjointed from the rest of the game. The focus of the ending is entirely different from the rest of the game, which can really throw you off. 
Now to the only good point, the look of the game. It is great to look at. The cinematics are fitting and the places you get to visit are beautifully rendered. Every action has an animation. A lot of work went into the graphic design and it is the only solid gold star I can give this game. 
Hopefully, Memento Mori 2 will be less of a disapppointment. I bought the Memento Mori Bundle for 7.99. Memento More 2 will have to be incredible for me to believe that buying these games is worth suffering through the first one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198211183852', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1425912768}

author: {'steamid': '76561198012622954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 962, 'last_played': 1419379866}
review:
I decided to go 'negative' for my review on this game mostly because of its price. I enjoyed it but the number of flaws it has makes Â£9.99 too expensive. If I had to rate it I would give it 5/10. If you want to buy it, wait for a sale and I'd recommend you spend a maximum of Â£5 for it.

The most enjoyable bit of this game is its plot. It's nicely detailed, intriguing and unpredictable. The puzzles are mostly logical and enjoyable too.

The reason I give this game a mediocre score is that everything else is lack-lustre. The visuals are adequate, the background music ia a bit poor and the voice acting highly variable.The interface takes a little while to get used to. You have an iicon that appears over a useable object that should display what right click and left click will do but this icon is really hard to see.

The worst thing about the game is the script writing and characterisation. With the exception of Lara (one of the two player characters), everyone in the game seems pretty unpleasant. Conversations feel forced and too drawn out. Sometimes it is even difficult to figure out what a character is trying to say because the wording is so weird and unnatural.

If you like story-rich point and clicks, wait for a sale and get this. Otherwise don't bother.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107869009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1406024253}
review: Memento Mori ist ein standardmÃ¤ÃŸiges Point & Klick Adventure. Das Spiel ist von 2008 und die Graphik war vermutlich schon damals nicht auf dem neuesten Stand. Insgesamt sieht Memento Mori durchaus ganz gut aus, nur wirken die Animationen alle etwas steif. Die Story braucht kurz, um Fahrt aufzunehmen, aber ist die erstmal da, fesselt sie einen durchaus sehr. Das Ende ist sehr gewÃ¶hnungsbedÃ¼rftig, es gibt acht mÃ¶gliche Enden der Handlung, aber die AuflÃ¶sung der gesamten Situation ist ohne zu spoilern inhaltlich ziemlich abstrakt und weit hergeholt. Ich hÃ¤tte mir ein schlÃ¼ssigeres Ende gewÃ¼nscht. Der Titel hat im Ã¼brigen eher weniger mit dem Inhalt zu tun. Das "Memento Mori" des Barock ("Gedenke des Todes") findet hier keinen wesentlichen Anklang. Ich habe fast 8h gebraucht, um Memento Mori durchzuspielen. Ich hÃ¤tte wesentlich lÃ¤nger gebraucht, hÃ¤tte vermutlich gar ganz aufgegeben, wenn es keine KomplettlÃ¶sungen geben wÃ¼rde. An vielen Stellen ist das Spiel in dem Sinne nicht schwer, aber es ist viel Zeit nÃ¶tig, bis man irgendwann mal ein Detailchen findet, auf welches man noch nicht geklickt hat, was dann aber angeklickt werden muss, damit es weitergeht. Die RÃ¤tsel werden vor allem zum Ende hin durchaus auch ziemlich schwer. Ich empfehle Memento Mori fÃ¼r diejenigen, die in diesem Genre gerne unterwegs sind. Allen anderen empfehle ich eher die Finger davon zu lassen. Dieses Spiel ist ein angenehmes Erlebnis, aber hat mich nicht so sehr vom Hocker gerissen, wie manch anderer Titel es getan hat.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999111837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1400472426}
review: Stilted dialog, pixel-hunting, and counter-intuitive puzzles make this an example of what's wrong with modern-day point-and-clicks.  None of this is as bad as the awful dialog system, however, in which you are typically presented with 3 different responses: positive, negative, and curious.  The problem is that the game doesn't bother to tell you the specifics of what your character will say when you pick one of these--you just have to pick the attitude that most closely matches what you WANT to say and hope that that's what the game designers had in mind as well.  The story probably would have been interesting if not for the badly written and poorly voice-acted dialog.  Can't recommend this one.

review:
este juego es un verdadero thriller; de investigacion en san petesburgo. de un suceco de expedio de informacion de enigmaticas suceciones ostentivas a la potentad cristiana. de un mito qe debe ser rellevado y sacarlo ala realidad por un investigador y una ex reportera qe se meten el destino qe les hallazge en mediom camino .

author: {'steamid': '76561198069912836', 'num_games_owned': 321, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1398789613}
review:
Der Anfang handelt von BanalitÃ¤ten, die ohne literarischen Wert ausgeschmÃ¼ckt werden und keine Relevanz haben. Wenn man einen Hotspot untersucht hÃ¶rt man sich wenigstens drei Zeilen Monolog an, was weder interessant ist noch einem weiterhilft. Die Heldin steht dabei in der Gegend rum und gestikuliert mit dem Finger als wolle sie irgendjemanden belehren.

Es ist problematisch nach einer Pause fortzufahren, weil es keine Infos in der Umgebung gibt, was grade zu tun ist oder worum es geht. Und dummerweise hat niemand bei gamefaqs einen Text darÃ¼ber eingestellt. Selbst die schlechtesten Spiele der Welt haben einen Walkthrough bei gamefaqs.

Mausbeschleunigung und Framerate sind katastrophal.

Man muss mit Umgebungsobjekten interagieren, die kaum im Bild sind wegen der Kamera. Und man kann entgegen der Intuition manche Bereiche nicht betreten, wie Laras Schlafzimmer. 

Es erscheint wie die Imitation eines Point and Click Adventures, wo die Designer nur die Symptome nachgebildet haben ohne Ã¼ber das Konzept nachzudenken und was die Gameplay Elemente zusammenhÃ¤lt. Der Inhalt wirkt aufgeblasen und oberflÃ¤chlich so a la: "Unsere Heldin ist eine Russin, die bei Interpol in Frankreich arbeitet! Wir haben Kultur!" Wer seine Heldin durch eine Duschszene etablieren muss, scheint Probleme zu haben das Interesse des Spielers zu wecken. Und wer Dialogzeilen kÃ¼nstlich in die LÃ¤nge zieht oder den Spieler dazu zwingt minutenlang emails zu lesen, scheint Probleme zu haben das Interesse des Spielers aufrecht zu erhalten.

In aller Fairness mÃ¶chte ich aber dennoch erst das Ende erleben bevor ich mein Urteil fÃ¤lle, denn die Geschichte ist angeblich der beste Teil davon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038378508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1394489265}
review:
Ich bin ja eigentlich kein groÃŸer Spieler von Point and Click Adventuren, auch wenn ich bereits einige von diesen gespielt habe und von den meisten wohl eher enttÃ¤uscht war. Umso erstaunlicher ist es, wie begeistert ich von diesem Titel bin. 
Es ist natÃ¼rlich eine grundsÃ¤tzliche Frage was man von dieser Spielegattung an sich hÃ¤lt, aber wer sich damit auch nur ein wenig anfreunden kann, dem ist dieses Spiel zu empfehlen.
Es hat wirklich einige SchwÃ¤chen, von der etwas altbackenen Grafik, die aber durchaus noch gut aussieht, Ã¼ber die zum Teil nicht ganz gelungene Synchro bis hin zum Fehlen schwerer RÃ¤tsel.
Wobei letzteres in meinen Augen gar keine SchwÃ¤che war... es spielt sich viel mehr als ein interaktiver Film in dem man eine Geschichte mit einigen interessanten Wendungen erlebt und das einen besonders gegen Ende wohl doch sicher noch Ã¼berraschen kann, zumal das Spiel auch mit 8 verschiedenen Enden aufwarten kann.
FÃ¼r mich persÃ¶nlich besitzt es sogar einen relativ groÃŸen Wiederspielwert und ich werde es mir sicherlich ein zweites Mal zu GemÃ¼te fÃ¼hren. 
Aufgrund der jedoch relativ kurzen Dauer ist es jedoch wohl eher ein "HÃ¤ppchen" fÃ¼r Zwischendurch. Aber besonders Point and Click Einsteiger oder Gelgenheitsspieler im Allgemeinen werden damit sicherlich ihren SpaÃŸ haben und ich kann es nur wÃ¤rmstens empfehlen da mal einen Blick darauf zu werfen... in einem Sale sollte man auch gar nicht lange zÃ¶gern und sich einfach mal darauf einlassen, lange braucht man zum durchspielen ohnehin nicht.
Ich bereue den Kauf keinesfalls und bin Ã¼berrascht, dass mich dieses Spiel so fesseln konnte... ich habe jetzt definitiv Lust auf mehr !

author: {'steamid': '76561198083431829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1394480658}
review:
I really enjoyed this game. And at a cost of less than Â£1 it was an absolute bargain. For the price I paid I thought it would be a short game that I'd complete in just a few hours but its actually quite a long game with lots of locations, many items to pick up and many things to investigate at each location. The puzzles aren't too simplistic either.
Easily one of the better Adventure games I have played in recent times.

review: Memento Mori ist ein klassisches Point and Click Adventure, die Bildszenen sind sehr schÃ¶n dargestellt und die Zwischensequenzen, die immer wieder mal eingespielt werden, sind auch nett anzuschauen. Nach gemÃ¼tlichen 11 Stunden Spielzeit hatte ich das Game durchgespielt. Einziges kleines Manko meinerseits wÃ¤re, dass die RÃ¤tsel ein wenig zu einfach waren. Da hÃ¤tte ich mir dann doch etwas schwierigere Aufgaben gewÃ¼nscht. Ansonsten kann ich Memento Mori jedem empfehlen der dieses Genre mag. Aber auch fÃ¼r blutige "Point and Click Adventure"-Einsteiger ist es definitiv zu empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074169975', 'num_games_owned': 820, 'num_reviews': 694, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1393441863}
review: If there is one thing that impressed me in this game, it's the fact that there are animations to every action and all of them fit perfectly with the surroundings. In most of games, there are generic animations to take or put an object, but not in this one. That's a huge work the devs have done. This really is a good game, with many endings, even if the story is a bit special (but i won't spoil).

review:
Ein sehr schÃ¶nes Spiel welches SpaÃŸ macht, die voraussetzung ist natÃ¼rlich dass man Point and Click Adventures mag sonst kÃ¶nnte es nach hinten los gehen. Ich hatte insgesamt sehr wenige Erwartungen da ich blind gekauft habe und positiv Ã¼berrascht wurde. Es gibt wirklich Stellen wo man mit den Charakteren mitfiebert und ihnen regelrecht die Daumen drÃ¼ckt. Dennoch muss dazu gesagt werden dass das Spiel auch ein paar SchwÃ¤chen hat, bei mir ist es mal abgestÃ¼rzt und sowas. Insgesamt ist es schon schlÃ¼ssig, manchmal muss man aber etwas nachdenken und auch kreativ sein denn manchmal fÃ¼hren mehrere Wege ans Ziel was mir gut gefÃ¤llt. Wer also auf die Art Spiele steht sollte mal zuschlagen wenn es im Sale ist. 
Achja, die Spielzeit ist recht gut gewesen, wer mehr Ãœbung hat kommt natÃ¼rlich schneller durch da er weiÃŸ was zu tun ist. Point and Clicks Ã¤hneln sich ja in diversen Punkten doch immer mal, so auch hier. Die Geschichte wird aber schÃ¶n erzÃ¤hlt und das ist auch nicht unwichtig bei solchen Spielen.
